meanings.def: to put or keep somebody/something in a place where they/it cannot be seen or found
examples: hide somebody/something + adv./prep. He hid the letter in a drawer.
hide somebody/something I keep my private papers hidden.
hide somebody/something from something (+ adv./prep.) They hid me from the police in their attic.
He hid the book under his bed.
I'll find a better place to hide it.
It had been cleverly hidden under furniture.

meanings.def: to go somewhere where you hope you will not be seen or found
examples: Quick, hide!
+ adv./prep. I hid under the bed.
hide from somebody (+ adv./prep.) We hid from our pursuers in an empty house.
hide yourself + adv./prep. She hides herself away in her office all day.
She wanted to run away and hide.
He could easily hide in the woods.
He quickly hid behind a large plant.
They were hiding among the bushes.
figures hiding in the shadows
They're hiding from the police.
(figurative) He accused the president of preferring to hide from the truth.

meanings.def: to cover somebody/something so that they/it cannot be seen
examples: hide something + adv./prep. He hid his face in his hands.
hide something The house was hidden by trees.
The brim of his hat hid half his face.
No amount of make-up could hide her age.
He had a weak mouth which he hid beneath a beard.
The TV was discreetly hidden in a corner.
tiny villages hidden deep in the softly rolling hills

meanings.def: to keep something secret, especially your feelings
examples: They didn't try to hide the fact that the film was a remake.
I have never tried to hide the truth about my past.
She struggled to hide her disappointment.
They claim that they have nothing to hide (= there was nothing wrong or illegal about what they did).
His brusque manner hides a shy and sensitive nature.
I could not hide my joy at seeing him again.
He hid the letter in a drawer.
She managed to hide her disappointment.
The paintings were concealed beneath a thick layer of plaster.
Tim could barely conceal his disappointment.
She covered her face with her hands.
He tried to disguise his accent.
She masked her anger with a smile.
The soldiers camouflaged themselves with leaves and twigs.
He had deliberately hidden the illness from his boss.
The government tried to hide the evidence from the public.
The truth may well remain hidden forever.
He made no attempt to hide his anger
Hypnotherapy can bring out previously hidden emotions.
She could barely hide her distaste.
She was unable to hide her delight at his failure.
feelings that she had kept completely hidden all these years

meanings.def: to refuse to admit that a problem exists or refuse to deal with it
to hide the real situation or facts when these are not good or pleasant
examples: She was dressed in loose comfortable clothes that hid a multitude of sins.

meanings.def: to not let people know that you are good at something
used to say that whatever you do, you cannot escape the consequences of your actions

idioms.idiom: bury/hide your head in the sand
idioms.def: to refuse to admit that a problem exists or refuse to deal with it
to hide the real situation or facts when these are not good or pleasant
examples: She was dressed in loose comfortable clothes that hid a multitude of sins.

idioms.idiom: hide your light under a bushel
idioms.def: to not let people know that you are good at something

idioms.idiom: you can run but you can't hide
idioms.def: used to say that whatever you do, you cannot escape the consequences of your actions

related: bury/hide your head in the sand
hide your light under a bushel
not see hide nor hair of somebody/something

meanings.def: a place from which people can watch wild animals or birds, without being seen by them
an animal’s skin, especially when it is bought or sold or used for leather
examples: boots made from buffalo hide
a black hide belt
The hide is tanned for leather.

meanings.def: used to refer to somebody’s life or safety when they are in a difficult situation
examples: All he's worried about is his own hide (= himself).

meanings.def: not to see somebody/something for some time
examples: I haven't seen hide nor hair of her for a month.

meanings.def: to try to avoid death, punishment, etc., especially by leaving others in an extremely difficult situation
examples: To save his own skin, he lied and blamed the accident on his friend.

idioms.idiom: not see hide nor hair of somebody/something
idioms.def: not to see somebody/something for some time
examples: I haven't seen hide nor hair of her for a month.

examples: To save his own skin, he lied and blamed the accident on his friend.
